it.unica.foresee.interpreters

Class FSCommandList

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unica.foresee.interpreters.FSCommandList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommandList
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ARTCommandList

    public class FSCommandList
extends java.lang.Object
implements CommandList
    List of commands for the interpreter and their semantic.

    Follows a list of the available commands in alphabetical order:

    • addpersonaldata - add personal demographic data to the according to the inserted values

      Syntax: addpersonaldata <gender> [age job zipcode]

      Arguments:

      • gender:
      • age: optional
      • job: optional
      • zipcode: optional

    • clustering - allows to work on the clustering

      Syntax: clustering load|calculate <cd|kmlocal|kmlocalpersonalprediction|kmeanspersonalprediction|kmeans> [numclusters]

      Arguments:

      • load: mark a cluster for loading. This process needs to be finalized with the command initcommunities.
      • calculate: calculates the clustering using the specified algorithm among <cd|kmlocal|kmlocalpersonalprediction|kmeanspersonalprediction|kmeans>
      • numclusters: optional integer to specify the cluster number

    • exit - command to quit the program

      Syntax: exit [exit_status]

      Arguments:

      • exit_status: optional integer to force the exit status

    • forcek - force the experiment to use a single fold

      Syntax: forcek <value>

      Arguments:

      • value: the k-esim fold on which execute the experiment

    • initcommunities - loads a cluster inside the data stucture of the framework loaded with the clustering command

      Syntax: initcommunities <clustering_type> [mingroupsize]

      Arguments:

      • clustering_type: type of clustering
      • mingroupsize: minimum size of the group

    • initmodeling - start the modeling of the groups, according to the specified parameters

      Syntax: initmodeling <modeling|type|prediction_type> [coratings|coratings top|coratings top trust|coratings top trust personalprediction]

      Arguments:

      • options undocumented

    • initsets - subdivides the sets in k subsets in preparation for the use of the k-fold algorithm

      Syntax: initsets load|calculate [k-value]

      Arguments:

      • calculate: use the dataset to create the k subsets
      • load: load a group of sets already subdivided
      • k-value: optional integer to specify the amount of sets to obtain
